author: krystian-wojtas
body:
# Tool to profile code

Is there available any tool to show how many times each line of powershell script code was executed?

comments.author: fMichaleczek
comments.body:
@krystian-wojtas in PowerShell, you have : 
- [Measure-Command](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/powershell/module/microsoft.powershell.utility/measure-command?view=powershell-6)
- [Trace-Command](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/powershell/module/Microsoft.PowerShell.Utility/Trace-Command?view=powershell-6)

In trace-command, there is a parameter ListenerOption that can be configured with Timestamp, but if you trace with a lot of options, you code will not run at same speed.

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body: We have the idea without any progress https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/issues/7857#issuecomment-425985568

title: Feature Request: code profiler
